fields.summary: Add CLI to list applications by final-status

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description: Nowadays RM web services getApps() accepts many more filters than ApplicationCLI "list" command, which only accepts "state" and "type". IMHO, ideally, different interfaces should provide consistent functionality. Is it better to allow more filters in ApplicationCLI?
fields.summary: RM web services getApps() accepts many more filters than ApplicationCLI "list" command

comments.body: I think it definitely make sense to add the missing filters in ApplicationCLI.

Added other RM web service filters to ApplicationCLI.
Concretely: finalStatus, user, queue, limit, startedTimeBegin, startedTimeEnd, finishedTimeBegin and finishedTimeEnd.

Thank you for reviewing, [~zjshen]. Attached an updated patch.
- Added "tags" option as "appTags".
- The "queue" option is also available as an application filter in this patch.
- Removed local filter and changed to use ApplicationClientProtocol#getApplications via YarnClient. Only "finalStatus" filter is leaved because of unsupported operation.
Moving all tickets targeted for the already closed release 2.6.0 into 2.6.1/2.7.2.
Should this be targeted to 2.6.2? We're trying to release 2.6.1 soon. Let me know.
Unless the patch is ready to go and the JIRA is a critical fix, we'll defer it to 2.6.2. Let me know if you have comments. Thanks!
[~kj-ki], [~zjshen], any update on this JIRA?
Targeting 2.6.3 now that 2.6.2 has shipped.
Moving out all non-critical / non-blocker issues that didn't make it out of 2.7.2 into 2.7.3.
Hi, can we move this out of 2.6.3? Thanks!
Move it to 2.6.4 as no update on JIRA for a while.
Move it out of 2.6.4 given no update in this JIRA for a long time.
2.7.3 is under release process, changing target-version to 2.7.4.
Moving target version to 2.7.5 due to 2.7.4 release.
